lexUnit.name: loathing.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a feeling of extreme disgust

sentence.text: But they feel torn between their loathing for General Noriega 's drug-based regime , and their alarm at the cavalier flouting of the OAS principle of non-intervention .
Trent could no longer contain his loathing for the Latino .
In spite of his loathing for her , in spite of the wickedness that had taken hold of him , Beth would persevere .
He suggest that behind Raskolnikov 's sister 's loathing of him there lurks attraction , and he states flatly that she and his own wife were once in love with each other ; and perhaps he is right .
I have an absolute loathing of inflation , I want to extend choice and opportunity and want Britain to have a very proud and assured place in the world .
Julia is not an artist , except in the kitchen ; but she has something of her creator 's buoyancy of mind , as well as her loathing of artificial sociability .
Described by police as ` one of the most evil and dangerous men in Britain " his grisly plan was fuelled by deep loathing of authority .
But amazingly her dreams were untainted by the intensity of her loathing .
You had me imprisoned by your loathing -- most of the time .
She flashed Frau Geller and her companion a glance of the deepest loathing .
The old man blinks up through milky , uncomprehending eyes as the father , leaning over the table on knuckled hands , spits out his loathing in a voice too low to be overheard .
To both of them , the human sacrifice of 1914-18 created not just a deep loathing of war but also a determination that such sacrifice should not be in vain .
With his conscious self , Lewis had a very distinct loathing of Ulster Protestantism .
He remembers what it feels like to experience intense hunger and profound thirst , irrational loathing and sublime contentment .
All that remained with her was the look in her son 's eyes , a look of absolute loathing and hatred , a look of betrayal .
He looked towards Peg , who was staring at him with undisguised loathing .
Lambert looked at Woolley with dull loathing .
Bitterly aware of a deep tide of crimson flooding over her face and body , she could only glare back at him with deep loathing .
